action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: I will start by guessing a common five-letter English word to get an initial sense of the letters.
guess: house

attempts = 1
target_word = imply
guess = house
guess_feedback = h<red> o<red> u<red> s<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: h<red> o<red> u<red> s<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since all the letters in the word "house" are marked red, I will try a new word that has different letters. I will choose a word that is also common and has a good distribution of letters.
guess: batch

attempts = 2
target_word = imply
guess = batch
guess_feedback = b<red> a<red> t<red> c<red> h<red>

guess_feedback: b<red> a<red> t<red> c<red> h<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: With all letters in "batch" marked red, I will try another word with a different set of letters. I will choose a word that is relatively common and has a diverse set of letters.
guess: fungi

attempts = 3
target_word = imply
guess = fungi
guess_feedback = f<red> u<red> n<red> g<red> i<yellow>

guess_feedback: f<red> u<red> n<red> g<red> i<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "i" is marked yellow, indicating it is in the word but not in the correct position. I will try to use "i" in a different position in the next guess, along with other relatively common letters.
guess: limit

attempts = 4
target_word = imply
guess = limit
guess_feedback = l<yellow> i<yellow> m<yellow> i<red> t<red>

guess_feedback: l<yellow> i<yellow> m<yellow> i<red> t<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "l", "i", and "m" are marked yellow, indicating they are in the word but not in the correct position. Since "i" appears twice in the guess and one is marked red, I will use "i" only once in the next guess. I will try to rearrange these letters and add new ones.
guess: milky

attempts = 5
target_word = imply
guess = milky
guess_feedback = m<yellow> i<yellow> l<yellow> k<red> y<green>

guess_feedback: m<yellow> i<yellow> l<yellow> k<red> y<green>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "m", "i", and "l" are still marked yellow, and "y" is now marked green, indicating it is in the correct position. I will keep "y" at the end and try to correctly place "m", "i", and "l".
guess: limpy
Guesser Error: NOT_VALID_WORD_FOR_GAME while parsing Player 1's (model: llama-4-maverick) response

Your guess is not a valid word for this game. Please try again.

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since "y" is in the correct position, I will keep it at the end. I will rearrange the yellow letters "m", "i", and "l" to form a valid English word.
guess: filmy

attempts = 6
target_word = imply
guess = filmy
guess_feedback = f<red> i<yellow> l<yellow> m<yellow> y<green>
game_result = LOSS

guess_explanation: I will start by guessing a common five-letter English word to get an initial sense of the letters.
Since all the letters in the word "house" are marked red, I will try a new word that has different letters. I will choose a word that is also common and has a good distribution of letters.
With all letters in "batch" marked red, I will try another word with a different set of letters. I will choose a word that is relatively common and has a diverse set of letters.

The letter "i" is marked yellow, indicating it is in the word but not in the correct position. I will try to use "i" in a different position in the next guess, along with other relatively common letters.

The letters "l", "i", and "m" are marked yellow, indicating they are in the word but not in the correct position. Since "i" appears twice in the guess and one is marked red, I will use "i" only once in the next guess. I will try to rearrange these letters and add new ones.
Since "y" is in the correct position, I will keep it at the end. I will rearrange the yellow letters "m", "i", and "l" to form a valid English word.
